segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Audit Certification Services, which determines whether the operating system generates events when Active Directory Certificate Services (ADÂ CS) operations are performed.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Audit Certification Services, which determines whether the operating system generates events when Active Directory Certificate Services (ADÂ CS) operations are performed.

segment.source: Audit Certification Services determines whether the operating system generates events when Active Directory Certificate Services (AD CS) operations are performed.
segment.target: Audit Certification Services determines whether the operating system generates events when Active Directory Certificate Services (AD CS) operations are performed.

segment.source: Examples of AD CS operations include:
segment.target: Examples of AD CS operations include:

segment.source: AD CS starts, shuts down, is backed up, or is restored.
segment.target: AD CS starts, shuts down, is backed up, or is restored.

segment.source: Certificate revocation list (CRL)-related tasks are performed.
segment.target: Certificate revocation list (CRL)-related tasks are performed.

segment.source: Certificates are requested, issued, or revoked.
segment.target: Certificates are requested, issued, or revoked.

segment.source: Certificate manager settings for AD CS are changed.
segment.target: Certificate manager settings for AD CS are changed.

segment.source: The configuration and properties of the certification authority (CA) are changed.
segment.target: The configuration and properties of the certification authority (CA) are changed.

segment.source: A CA certificate is published to Active Directory Domain Services.
segment.target: A CA certificate is published to Active Directory Domain Services.

segment.source: Security permissions for AD CS role services are modified.
segment.target: Security permissions for AD CS role services are modified.

segment.source: Keys are archived, imported, or retrieved.
segment.target: Keys are archived, imported, or retrieved.

segment.source: The OCSP Responder Service is started or stopped.
segment.target: The OCSP Responder Service is started or stopped.

segment.source: Monitoring these operational events is important to ensure that AD CS role services are functioning properly.
segment.target: Monitoring these operational events is important to ensure that AD CS role services are functioning properly.

segment.source: Event volume: Low to medium on servers that provide AD CS role services.
segment.target: Event volume: Low to medium on servers that provide AD CS role services.

segment.source: Role-specific subcategories are outside the scope of this document.
segment.target: Role-specific subcategories are outside the scope of this document.

segment.source: IF – if a server has the Active Directory Certificate Services (AD CS) role installed and you need to monitor AD CS related events, enable this subcategory.
segment.target: IF – if a server has the Active Directory Certificate Services (AD CS) role installed and you need to monitor AD CS related events, enable this subcategory.

segment.source: IF – if a server has the Active Directory Certificate Services (AD CS) role installed and you need to monitor AD CS related events, enable this subcategory.
segment.target: IF – if a server has the Active Directory Certificate Services (AD CS) role installed and you need to monitor AD CS related events, enable this subcategory.

segment.source: Active Directory Certificate Services (AD CS) role cannot be installed on client OS.
segment.target: Active Directory Certificate Services (AD CS) role cannot be installed on client OS.

segment.source: 4868: The certificate manager denied a pending certificate request.
segment.target: 4868: The certificate manager denied a pending certificate request.

segment.source: 4869: Certificate Services received a resubmitted certificate request.
segment.target: 4869: Certificate Services received a resubmitted certificate request.

segment.source: 4871: Certificate Services received a request to publish the certificate revocation list (CRL).
segment.target: 4871: Certificate Services received a request to publish the certificate revocation list (CRL).

segment.source: 4872: Certificate Services published the certificate revocation list (CRL).
segment.target: 4872: Certificate Services published the certificate revocation list (CRL).

segment.source: 4874: One or more certificate request attributes changed.
segment.target: 4874: One or more certificate request attributes changed.

segment.source: 4875: Certificate Services received a request to shut down.
segment.target: 4875: Certificate Services received a request to shut down.

segment.source: 4882: The security permissions for Certificate Services changed.
segment.target: 4882: The security permissions for Certificate Services changed.

segment.source: 4883: Certificate Services retrieved an archived key.
segment.target: 4883: Certificate Services retrieved an archived key.

segment.source: 4884: Certificate Services imported a certificate into its database.
segment.target: 4884: Certificate Services imported a certificate into its database.

segment.source: 4885: The audit filter for Certificate Services changed.
segment.target: 4885: The audit filter for Certificate Services changed.

segment.source: 4886: Certificate Services received a certificate request.
segment.target: 4886: Certificate Services received a certificate request.

segment.source: 4887: Certificate Services approved a certificate request and issued a certificate.
segment.target: 4887: Certificate Services approved a certificate request and issued a certificate.

segment.source: 4888: Certificate Services denied a certificate request.
segment.target: 4888: Certificate Services denied a certificate request.

segment.source: 4889: Certificate Services set the status of a certificate request to pending.
segment.target: 4889: Certificate Services set the status of a certificate request to pending.

segment.source: 4890: The certificate manager settings for Certificate Services changed.
segment.target: 4890: The certificate manager settings for Certificate Services changed.

segment.source: 4891: A configuration entry changed in Certificate Services.
segment.target: 4891: A configuration entry changed in Certificate Services.

segment.source: 4892: A property of Certificate Services changed.
segment.target: 4892: A property of Certificate Services changed.

segment.source: 4894: Certificate Services imported and archived a key.
segment.target: 4894: Certificate Services imported and archived a key.

segment.source: 4895: Certificate Services published the CA certificate to Active Directory Domain Services.
segment.target: 4895: Certificate Services published the CA certificate to Active Directory Domain Services.

segment.source: 4896: One or more rows have been deleted from the certificate database.
segment.target: 4896: One or more rows have been deleted from the certificate database.
